post.title: Careers in Tech for Women to Pursue
post.excerpt: With access to free online courses, scholarships, and various learning resources, you can learn any tech skill of your choice.
post.content:
For women who are interested in exploring careers in tech, the opportunities are endless. With access to free online courses, scholarships, and various learning resources, you can learn any tech skill of your choice. 

There are many different roles to pursue, from cybersecurity to software development to UI/UI design; you can explore and excel in any field you choose, even the ones considered the most challenging. Take a look at some exciting roles you can discover in the tech world.

  1. Software Engineer

Software engineers create, develop, test, maintain and access computer software using programming languages like HTML, CSS, Java, Python, etc. Using engineering principles, they meet users’ needs by creating software solutions. To become a software engineer, you need to have problem-solving and analytical skills. There are different roles to explore in the software engineering field,  including Security Engineers, Front-end Engineers, Backend Engineers, Quality Assurance Engineers, Full-stack Engineers, DevOps Engineers, etc.

  1. Data Analyst

A data analyst collects, processes and interprets data intending to solve a problem. They use different tools and methods to identify trends and present the findings to help organizations make better decisions. They turn unprocessed data into valuable insights to improve the company’s operations. A data analyst can work in almost every industry. For you to become a successful data analyst, you must have good analytical, technical and numerical skills.

  1. Software Developer

Software developers are creatives who use programming languages to design, program, build and maintain computer systems and applications to cater for users’ needs. We have two types of developers: application software developers and system software developers. Although they perform similar tasks, they focus on different aspects of development.

The roles of software developers and software engineers are different from each other. Software developers design and build specific application software, while engineers create and test entire computer systems and applications for organisations. Software development is a subset of software engineering. To be a successful software developer, it is important to have good problem-solving skills. There are different types of software developers; some of them are Front-end, back-end, full-stack, web, and mobile developers, to mention a few.

  1. UI/UX Designer

UI in it stands for User Interface, while UX stands for User Experience. Both are closely related yet distinct and important for a product’s success. UI design focuses on the visual and interactive elements of a product, while UX design focuses on creating a seamless and meaningful user experience; they do this by conducting research to identify users’ needs and painpoints and then designing a product that addresses them. You can either be a UI designer, UX designer or both. To become a successful designer, you should possess both creative and problem-solving skills.

  1. Product Manager

A product manager is someone who identifies customers’ needs and focuses on product strategy to plan, manage, develop and launch a product. They are considered to be at the intersection of business, design, and technology. They oversee a product from its initial stages to its final launch and ensure alignment with stakeholders throughout the product development process. To become a successful product manager, you need to have good communication and collaboration skills. 

  1. Cybersecurity Engineer

A cybersecurity engineer is an information security personnel who defends the organisation from cyber-attacks and intruders who pose a risk to the company. They do this by designing and implementing highly secure network solutions. To be a successful cybersecurity engineer, you need strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and problem-solving abilities.

  1. Digital Marketing Manager

A digital marketing manager is responsible for creating, managing, executing, and strategising marketing campaigns that promote the company’s brand, products, and services. They help increase the company’s growth and visibility by analysing data and drawing insights from it, maintaining a social media presence, and more. To be a successful digital manager, you must possess excellent communication skills and creative thinking abilities.

As an aspiring woman in tech, it’s important to know that different roles are available to explore beyond the ones commonly discussed. To pursue any tech career of your choice, it is important to obtain education by taking relevant courses, building experience, developing soft skills, finding a good mentor, networking with like-minded people, and always being ready to learn and grow.
